title: Enable features::kSitePerProcess for chrome parity
body:
Alternatively, we can trun on switches::kSitePerProcess in
browser-laptop by default, otherwise we have to provide a toggle
`switches::kDisableSiteIsolationTrials` which is equivalent to
`site-isolation-trial-opt-out` in `chrome://flags`
see `SiteIsolationPolicy::UseDedicatedProcessesForAllSites`

Auditors: @bridiver, @diracdeltas

title: Add protocol.registerStreamProtocol
body:
Ports `protocol.registerStreamProtocol` from: https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/11008/

To land cleanly, that changeset requires other upstream changes to be ported:

- `CallEmitWithArgs` generalised to `CallMethodWithArgs` and it's signature changed to take the method name to call here: https://github.com/electron/electron/commit/6d92457095c9b45a169296aa8be31388158948ba#diff-f7906bd787aa49d23220731778d7fa87

- Changed signature, to match the muon impl of

```c
bool Converter<const net::HttpResponseHeaders*>::FromV8
```
in: /electron/atom/common/native_mate_converters/net_converter.cc

The good news is that muon compiles with the ported changes, and using a fork of [ipfs-companion](https://github.com/tableflip/ipfs-companion/tree/feat/register-stream-protocol) I'm able to "stream"  a response from ipfs via muon to brave.

![screen shot 2018-02-23 at 16 43 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58871/36607389-6e4fa8ce-18be-11e8-81e2-fcee06a36523.png)

I should qualify that I'm pretty good at spelunking around in codebases and porting things that look like they might work, but I have little C++ experience, so I'm offering this up as a starting point for discussion as a fix for https://github.com/brave/browser-laptop/issues/10629 

~~Also of note, I'd like to find a nicer way to stream the response over from the proxy impl of `protocol.renderStreamProtocol` in protocol_bindings.js, to the main process. I naively tried to use https://github.com/jprichardson/electron-ipc-stream but I'm not clear on the environment that the js in atom/common/resources/protocol_bindings.js is run in.~~ 

Streaming works sensibly now thanks to @alanshaw

title: Chromium ContentBrowserclient Embedder api  IsHandledUrl was not impl…
body:
Chromium ContentBrowserclient Embedder api IsHandledUrl was not implemented. Add the implementation for the same. This should be in sync with registered protocol handlers.

fix https://github.com/brave/browser-laptop/issues/10644
